First, the ultrasound needs to be medically indicated. And second, if you are low risk and without maternal medical issues, I would say about 3 scans. Your 12 weeker for dating purposes, a 20 week anatomy survey, and a third trimester (about 32 weeks) growth scan for estimated weight, position, and amniotic fluid check. This is assuming an uncomplicated pregnancy. If you were to develop GDM, for example, you would have more scans.
I had my first at 8 weeks then 16, 20, and stating at 29 weeks I have had one every week for a bpp because of preeclampsia. Im 35 weeks now.

I had dating scan at seven weeks, genetic screening with the nuchal translucency ultrasound at 12 weeks and anatomy scan at 20 weeks.  Those are all standard for my doctors office.  Dont be afraid to ask them!
